comments.text:
cashew is brazilian and, my wild guess, is that english speakers call it 
cashew because of it's name in portuguese which is caju (it's pronounced 
"kahjoo"). the pulp part of the cashew is very tender, juicy and sweet. :)

so it's not the brazilian nut that is brazilian after all =P﻿

comments.text:
I knew most of those grew in that way, mostly pineapples because of 
RuneScape, and sprouts because I live in the countryside and they're grown 
sometimes round here. I found out peanuts grow in the ground as a child and 
some of the others over the years online. I like learning new things.

And why do you assume they're not growing 'normally' for the species they 
are? That's incredibly ignorant of you just to make a joke of it. Perhaps 
education is the key here.﻿
